title: What dynasty invented paper money? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Song dynasty - Wikipedia adopted a Total war - Wikipedia economy to deal with the Mongol invasion. They issued jiaozi or Flying cash - Wikipedia and were the first make them Legal tender - Wikipedia. They lost. As Marco Polo narrated, the Mongol Yuan dynasty - Wikipedia had a bright idea of forcing Chinese people to turn over precious metals, stones, silks, etc, and giving them paper certificates. The people stashed them instead & helped a peasant start a rebellion. He became the first Ming dynasty - Wikipedia Emperor. He mandated that silver would be the only legal tender. Then in 1565, the Spanish established a trade outpost in Manila. Silver was discovered in Mexico & later Peru. A match in heaven (Tian - Wikipedia) was made. The Spanish were the only Westerners to treat China with respect.
I don’t remember but failure to accept this early version of fiat currency was a capital crime. I want to say it was Chinggis Khan who introduced the first paper currency.
